[File: consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/single_entry/mod.rs] [SingleEntryKey: LastVote] [Key Overwrite] Can concurrent calls to save_vote() from different parts of the consensus code race to overwrite the LastVote entry, resulting in writing an older vote over a newer one and regressing the last_voted_round counter? [File: consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/single_entry/mod.rs] [SingleEntryKey: LastVote] [Recovery Attack] During consensus recovery after a crash, if get_last_vote() returns corrupted data that partially decodes, can the validator initialize with an inconsistent safety state that allows voting in rounds it has already voted in? [File: consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/single_entry/mod.rs] [SingleEntryKey: Highest2ChainTimeoutCert] [Liveness Attack] Can an attacker overwrite the Highest2ChainTimeoutCert entry with an artificially high timeout value, causing validators to incorrectly believe a timeout has occurred and unnecessarily advance rounds, disrupting consensus progress? [File: consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/single_entry/mod.rs] [SingleEntryKey: Highest2ChainTimeoutCert] [Certificate Validation] Since the schema stores raw Vec<u8> for timeout certificates without validation, can corrupted or maliciously crafted certificates bypass BLS signature verification during decode operations and cause consensus instability? [File: consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/single_entry/mod.rs] [SingleEntryKey: Highest2ChainTimeoutCert] [Deletion Attack] If delete_highest_2chain_timeout_certificate() is called maliciously or due to a bug, can the absence of timeout certificate data cause validators to disagree on timeout state and partition the network? (High)

[File: consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/single_entry/mod.rs] [SingleEntryKey: Highest2ChainTimeoutCert] [Monotonicity] Does the schema enforce that the timeout certificate round is monotonically increasing, or can an attacker overwrite a high-round certificate with a lower-round one, causing validators to regress their timeout state? (High)

[File: consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/single_entry/mod.rs] [SingleEntryKey: Highest2ChainTimeoutCert] [Size Limit] Can an attacker inject an extremely large timeout certificate (with many validator signatures) that exceeds memory limits when loaded via decode_value(), causing validators to OOM during startup? [File: consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/single_entry/mod.rs] [Schema Access] [Delete-Read Race] Can a delete_last_vote_msg() operation race with a concurrent get_last_vote() call, causing the read to return a tombstone value or corrupted data instead of a clean None result? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/single_entry/mod.rs] [Schema Access] [Epoch Transition Race] During epoch transitions when both LastVote and Highest2ChainTimeoutCert are being updated, can race conditions in the schema access layer cause one update to overwrite the other due to shared underlying RocksDB batch operations?
